question.text: The ionization energy of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> is <math><mn>19.6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1</mn><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>.</mo></math> The energy of the first stationary state of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math> will be

options.text: <math><mn>21.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></msup><mi></mi><mi></mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

<math><mn>44.10</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></msup><mi></mi><mi></mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

<math><mn>63.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></msup><mi></mi><mi></mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

<math><mn>84.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></msup><mi></mi><mi></mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

solution.text:
E1 for Li+2=E1 for H×Z2Li
E1 for He+=E1 for H×Z2He
Thus,
E1 for Li+2=94×E1 for He+
=94×19.6×10-18
=44.10×10-18J/atom
